ravetools 0.0.1

Export diagnostic plot (pwelch) for 'RAVE' subjects

Source: R/notch-diagnosis.R
export_diagnose_voltage.Rd

Export diagnostic plot (pwelch) for 'RAVE' subjects

export_diagnose_voltage(
  subject,
  electrodes,
  blocks,
  h5_names = c("/notch/{block}", "/raw/{block}"),
  save_dir = "./export",
  width = 12,
  height = 7,
  useDingbats = FALSE,
  onefile = TRUE,
  winlens,
  freq_lims,
  nclass = 20,
  cex = 1,
  col = c(fore_col, back_col),
  ...,
  fore_col = "black",
  back_col = "grey80"
)

Arguments

subject

character, or RAVESubject
electrodes

electrodes to generate plots
blocks

the session block number
h5_names

the 'HDF5' data names used
save_dir

where to save the 'PDF' files
width, height, useDingbats, onefile, ...

passed to pdf
winlens, freq_lims

see pwelch
nclass

number of bins in the histogram
cex

font size
col, fore_col, back_col

the color to use for different types of signals; by default signals after the 'Notch' filters uses fore_col color (black), and original trace uses back_col (grey) color

Value

Nothing, however, one or multiple 'PDF' files will be generated at save_dir directory.

Examples


# Please download RAVE demo subject first
if(interactive()){
  export_path <- tempfile()
  export_diagnose_voltage("demo/DemoSubject", 13:16,
                          "008", save_dir = export_path)
  # open the following path
  normalizePath(export_path)
}
